privacy.title: Privacy Policy
body: MoneyBear – Privacy Policy
Last updated: February 9, 2026
Effective date: February 9, 2026
This privacy policy ("Policy") explains how the MoneyBear app processes personal data.
Data controller:
Robinio Invest OÜ
Vesivärava 22-4, Tallinn, Estonia 10126
Web: moneybear.eu
Contact (including privacy requests): support@moneybear.eu
1. What data we process
1.1 Account and authentication data (Google/Firebase)
The app enables sign-in with a Google account and uses Firebase Authentication. We may process:
1. Firebase user identifier (UID);
2. name, email, and profile picture URL if provided by the Google account and displayed in the app;
3. technical authentication metadata (e.g., sign-in events required for service operation).
1.2 User-entered financial data (app content)
The app allows you to enter data that may be personal data, such as:
1. transactions (income/expense), amounts, currency, dates, categories, notes;
2. planned transactions;
3. budget and budget cycle settings;
4. "opening balance" (total balance on a selected date) for forecasts;
5. savings goals and related information.
These data are generally stored locally on your device in the app's private storage (e.g., local database and settings).
1.3 Free trial data
To manage the free trial, we may process a timestamp for the start of the trial period. It may be stored:
1. locally on the device;
2. as a record associated with your account in Firebase Firestore (to prevent unfair trial restarts and keep the trial account-based).
1.4 Premium subscription data (Google Play Billing)
Premium subscription is managed via Google Play. The app may process:
1. subscription status (active/inactive);
2. expiration time (if applicable);
3. technical data needed to validate the subscription (e.g., purchase token).
Payment data (e.g., card number) do not come to us; they are processed by Google Play.
To verify subscription validity, the app may transmit the purchase token and product ID to our Firebase Cloud Functions service, which checks the subscription.
1.5 Device backup and restore (Android backup/transfer)
Depending on your Android settings, Android may:
1. back up the app's local data to backups associated with your Google account;
2. restore the app's data when you change or restore your device.

This means that although MoneyBear does not provide separate cloud sync for your transactions (except for trial and subscription verification), your local app data may be transferred to Google backup services due to your own settings.
1.6 Technical data and logs
Third-party service providers (e.g., Google/Firebase) may collect technical logs (e.g., service errors, security events) for service operation and security.
2. Purposes of processing
We process data to:
1. provide the app's features and display user-entered data;
2. enable sign-in and link the app experience to the signed-in user;
3. separate information displayed in the app for different users on the same device based on the signed-in account;
4. manage the free trial;
5. manage the Premium subscription and verify its validity;
6. provide user support and ensure security and reliability.
3. Legal bases (GDPR)
Where GDPR applies, we primarily rely on:
1. performance of a contract (providing the app service, account, subscription);
2. legitimate interests (security, abuse prevention, service reliability, customer support);
3. legal obligations, where they arise (e.g., dispute resolution, accounting requirements to the extent they apply to us).
4. Who we share data with
We do not sell your personal data or share it for advertising purposes.
We may use service providers (processors), in particular:
1. Google Play / Google (subscriptions, billing, purchase history, anti-fraud);
2. Google Firebase (Authentication, Firestore, Cloud Functions) for sign-in, storing trial information, and subscription verification;
3. Android backup and device data transfer mechanisms (Google services) depending on your device settings.
We may disclose data where necessary to comply with legal obligations or protect rights.
5. Data retention
1. Local financial data remain on your device until you delete them (e.g., "Clear app data"), uninstall the app, or restore your device.
2. The trial start timestamp record (Firestore) generally remains until account deletion or a deletion request.
3. Subscription verification data are retained only to the minimum necessary extent; purchase history and billing information remain in Google Play systems according to Google's rules.
4. Device backups (if enabled) are retained according to your Google account and Android backup rules.
6. Security
1. Core app data are stored in the device's private storage.
2. The app uses the internet (e.g., sign-in, subscription verification) and data transmission is typically encrypted (TLS).
3. We recommend using a screen lock and keeping your Google account secure.
4. No security measure provides absolute protection; we take reasonable steps but cannot eliminate all risks.
7. Your rights
Depending on applicable law, you have the right to:
1. request access to your personal data;
2. request correction or deletion;
3. restrict processing or object (where based on legitimate interests);
4. request data portability where applicable.
How to request: write to support@moneybear.eu.
To fulfill a privacy request, we may ask for additional information to verify your identity (e.g., Google account email or Firebase UID).
8. How to delete data
1. Logging out in the app may not physically delete local data; it primarily removes access to the signed-in experience.
2. To delete local information, use Android's "Clear storage / Clear data" function or uninstall the app.
3. To request deletion of trial or account-related server data, write to support@moneybear.eu.
9. Children's privacy
1. The app is intended for general use and may also be used by minors.
2. The app uses Google sign-in; account creation and use are subject to Google's own rules.
3. If you are a parent/guardian and believe a minor has provided us data in a way that requires intervention, contact: support@moneybear.eu.
10. International transfers

Google/Firebase services may process data on servers outside the European Economic Area. In such cases, transfers rely on the legal mechanisms used by the provider (e.g., Standard Contractual Clauses), where applicable.
11. Changes to the privacy policy
We may update the Policy from time to time. The updated version will be published and the "Last updated" date will change.
12. Contact
Privacy questions and requests: support@moneybear.eu
Data controller: Robinio Invest OÜ, Vesivärava 22-4, Tallinn, Estonia 10126

body: MoneyBear – Terms of Service
Last updated: February 9, 2026
Effective date: February 9, 2026
These terms of service ("Terms") govern the use of the MoneyBear mobile app ("App", "Service"). By using the App, you agree to these Terms.
Service provider (us):
Robinio Invest OÜ
Vesivärava 22-4, Tallinn, Estonia 10126
Web: moneybear.eu
Email: support@moneybear.eu
If you do not agree to the Terms, do not use the App.
1. Service description
1. MoneyBear is a personal budgeting and cash flow tracking app.

2. The app allows you, among other things, to enter and manage transactions (income/expenses), planned transactions, budgets, categories, savings goals, and to set an "opening balance" (total balance on a specific date) to calculate balance forecasts.
3. The app does not provide banking services or access to your bank accounts; you enter the financial data yourself.
2. Changes to the Terms
1. We may change the Terms from time to time (e.g., legal changes, new features).
2. We will publish updated Terms on the website or in the App.
3. Continued use of the App after changes means acceptance of the new Terms.
3. Age and minors
1. The App is for general use and does not contain adult content.
2. If you are a minor, you confirm that you have a parent or guardian's permission to use the App and to take out a subscription (if applicable).
3. Using the App may require a Google account; use of that account is subject to Google's age and account rules.
4. Account and sign-in
1. The App uses a Google account for sign-in and Firebase Authentication for authentication.
2. You are responsible for keeping your Google account and device secure (e.g., screen lock, passwords).
3. If you suspect someone is using your account without authorization, notify us (support@moneybear.eu) and secure access to your Google account.
5. Free and Premium features
1. The App may include a free tier and a paid Premium ("Subscription").
2. Premium unlocks additional app features; the exact list may change and is shown in the App.
3. When Premium is active, the App may no longer show trial or subscription prompts.
6. Free trial
1. If a free trial is offered, its duration and terms are as shown in the App and/or Google Play.
2. The trial may be limited (e.g., once per account).
7. Subscription, billing, and cancellation (Google Play)
1. Premium purchases, billing, auto-renewal, cancellation, and refunds are handled under Google Play rules.
2. The subscription may renew automatically unless you cancel it in your Google Play account in time.
3. We cannot guarantee refunds beyond what Google Play allows.
8. Rules for using the App
You agree not to use the App in a way that:
1. violates the law or the rights of third parties;
2. attempts to breach the security of the App (hacking, malware, service disruption);
3. attempts to reverse engineer or derive the source code of the App, except to the extent permitted by law.
9. User content and data ownership
1. The data you enter in the App (transactions, categories, notes, etc.) belongs to you.
2. You grant us the right to process your data to the extent necessary to provide the Service (e.g., sync trial start, verify subscription validity, display your data in the App).
10. Service reliability and changes
1. We may change, improve, or limit the App (e.g., maintenance, bug fixes, feature changes).
2. We may temporarily suspend or discontinue the App, including where necessary for security or legal compliance.
11. Not financial advice
1. The App is a tool and is not financial, investment, tax advice, or an accounting service.
2. The App's calculations and forecasts depend on the accuracy of the data you enter. You make decisions at your own risk.
12. Limitation of liability
1. The App is provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis.
2. To the maximum extent permitted by law, we are not liable for indirect damages (e.g., lost profits, data loss, incorrect decisions) arising from:
1. inaccuracies in user-entered data;
2. interruptions of device or third-party services (e.g., Google Play, Firebase);
3. the fact that device backup/restore may copy or restore app data based on user settings.
3. Nothing in the Terms limits liability that cannot be excluded by law.
13. Third-party services
The App uses third-party services (e.g., Google Play, Google Sign-In, Firebase). Their services may be subject to separate terms.
14. Termination
1. You may stop using the App at any time (e.g., uninstall it).
2. We may restrict or terminate access if you violate the Terms or use the App unlawfully.
3. Subscription cancellation is handled via Google Play; uninstalling the App may not automatically cancel your subscription.
15. Governing law and dispute resolution
1. The Terms are governed by the laws of the Republic of Estonia.
2. Disputes will be attempted to be resolved first through negotiations.
3. If you are a consumer, you may have the right to refer the dispute to the Consumer Disputes Committee and to use EU dispute resolution options in accordance with applicable law.
4. If the dispute cannot be resolved, it will be resolved in an Estonian court (generally Harju County Court), unless mandatory consumer protection rules provide otherwise.
16. Contact
Questions and support: support@moneybear.eu
